website_summaries.verdict: This guide groups common butterflies by color for identification, and it gives tips about what to plant to attract butterflies to your own yard.
pros: Groups butterflies by color for easier identification
Filled with maps, line drawings, and color photographs of butterflies, as well as information about life cycles and larval stages
Also includes information to help you attract butterflies to your own yard
cons: Not as thorough of a reference source as other books

customer_reviews.title: We have already gotten so many great ideas on what to plant
customer_reviews.text: Gave this book to my sister-in-Law for Xmas. She wants to make a butterfly garden this spring. We have already gotten so many great ideas on what to plant, what butterflies are looking for in habitat, food, water, etc. Wonderful guide. Every gardener should have this book, even if they don't want to make a butterfly garden. Even if you don't wish to make a garden, you can attract them to your yard is a wonderful gift!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reader

customer_reviews.title: STOKES BUTTERFLY BOOK
customer_reviews.text: This book is very good. Lot of color and identifies plants for food and plants for egg laying. Lot of "How-To" for folks that want to help nature . How a back yard can be useful and help the world of nature. Just good advice and good way to get young people interested in the small world that can exist near us. Never too early to learn conservation. Larry
customer_reviews.author: SOMETIMES REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift
customer_reviews.text: Nice book for anyone interested in learning about butterflies. Good quality. I gave this as a gift and heard it was lovely
customer_reviews.author: House of McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Got for granddaughters
customer_reviews.text: I have a butterfly garden it’s small but granddaughters want to know more about the butterflies in it
customer_reviews.author: Annis

customer_reviews.title: helpful book
customer_reviews.text: my first years making a butterfly garden. This book was very helpful
customer_reviews.author: Rose L

customer_reviews.title: Getting to know beautiful butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Working at the Botanic Garden butterfly exhibit, I needed to know a great deal about our fluttery friends. This book, beautifully illustrated and carefully organized made this not only possible but pleasurable. And, it helped me plan my own butterfly garden. Who knew how many different families of butterflies there are, what a short time most of them live, all the ways they have learned to protect themselves. Did you know that one of their favorite drinks is gatorade?
customer_reviews.author: Docmitz

customer_reviews.title: Handy guide
customer_reviews.text: The two things I liked best about this book are the pages devoted to identifying butterflies by color (it groups them so that if you see one that is predominantly orange, you can look at the page of orange butterflies to find the one you're trying to identify), and the pages devoted to creating an attractive butterfly garden, with schemes showing how to arrange plants that attract butterflies. It's not a technical book, thereby making it a good guide for backyard butterfly enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spivey

customer_reviews.title: easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Love the beautiful pictures that help to identify the butterflies
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bergmark

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful information on the life and times of the elegant ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this book. Wonderful information on the life and times of the elegant butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: maggie k

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book in July 2001 (amazon told me when I went to reorder it) It's a great book. I have a few field guides for butterflys but I like this best. So after leaving it outside and letting it get caught in the rain I'm here almost 11 years later to buy another copy. Not many things that I would buy the exact same thing 11 years later, but that's how much I like this guide.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen K

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Book
customer_reviews.text: I am now a fan of the Stokes series of books. I have several on birds and they are wonderful. This butterfly book is no exception. I did not want anything technical. I wanted easy to read, easy to find the butterfly I was looking for (to identify) and lots of beautiful pictures. And this is what this book is all about! Enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: He is quite pleased; photos are clear
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my spouse. He is quite pleased; photos are clear, detailed and beautiful, text is easy to understand, not too complex, also recommends what plants to grow to attract species in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnye Karger

customer_reviews.title: butterfly gardens
customer_reviews.text: While visiting the Butterfly Garden exhibit in Boston's Science Museum, we asked a person in charge which book he recommended for growing one's own butterfly garden (my son lives in Framingham, MA). The answer was Stokes, and he wrote it down for us. The museum does not sell it. The number of butterflies identified is smaller than some guides, but the details about their preferred plants are very good. Since I bought the book for my son (I live in California), I cannot provide more details except that he and his wife are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace M. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Book
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this butterfly book. It has so much information, and she constantly refers to it, when she's in the garden tending to the butterfly house. Thank you again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Tresca

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great reference book on learning about butterflies, what to plant for them , how to attract
customer_reviews.author: gardenlady

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good and friendly book on butterflies and gardening to support them.
customer_reviews.author: William Fullmer

customer_reviews.title: Not hardcover
customer_reviews.text: This was listed as hardcover, but is otherwise as described, and appears to be a good reference book.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: The Butterfly Book is the best tool for adults and students to attract and conserve butterflies.
customer_reviews.text: This book covers the identification, biology and ecological requirements of the more common butterflies in the U.S. It has detailed photographs of adult and larval stages; food plants, suggested butterfly garden designs and instructions about conserving these insects in the local environment. Best book for the money. I have used it as a guide for 20 years!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Wenning

customer_reviews.title: A very informative book
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book for learnng about butterfly behavior, etc. I wouldn't purchase it as a guide...for that I would get a book that was specific to my location. I was looking for a book that described migration patterns and explained some of the behavior I saw, and this is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Dobrofsky

customer_reviews.title: super !
customer_reviews.text: quick service. item was exactly as described. The book is beautifully illustrated. I would recommend this book to anyone interested in butterfly gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Ricks

customer_reviews.title: they said it was great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a family member and...they said it was great.
customer_reviews.author: smalltowntex

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent resource. Shows many larvae. Exceptional photos. I bought 3.
customer_reviews.author: FleyeSci

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and Informative Butterfly Book
customer_reviews.text: Very informative book on butterflies. Definitely helps identifying different types.
customer_reviews.author: wunder

customer_reviews.title: Good Reference
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a very good reference book. I was hoping for more information about the catipiler stages but still seems to be one of the best books on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Perrelli

customer_reviews.title: Flutterbies Galore
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy and useful guide for general identification of common butterflies. It's a useful learning tool, and easy to read. The only criticism that I have, is that this guide rarely provides top AND bottom views of the butterflies that it contains. Overall, I'm very happy with this book, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a handy butterfly field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Dana E Gearhart

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed in this as this was a gift my granddaughter ...
customer_reviews.text: The book sent is not the edition pictured, it is a very old edition, the book cover is not even the same. False advertising. I am so disappointed in this as this was a gift my granddaughter requested. Kids are on top of things and she will recognize the difference and I know that information has most likely been updated from this first edition, 1991 and this is 2015! I have purchased used books before, but never have I had this happen.
customer_reviews.author: MimiH

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly Book Review
customer_reviews.text: I am a gardener and encourage butterflies to use my yard and garden. This book covers the butterflies which are native to my region and is a good one to use in identification. I am very pleased with it. The Stokes actually live not far from our village.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Stokes Butterfly Book: The Complete Guide to Butterfly Gardening, Identification, and Behavior
customer_reviews.text: Also a gift - they love this book and highly recommend it. It is thorough and colorful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eppley

customer_reviews.title: The Butterfly Book
customer_reviews.text: This book is very informative and a must have for butterfly gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great boo
customer_reviews.text: I am planting on sowing flower mixtures out back for butterflies and hummingbirds. I hope I can take pictures of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent book well written, well illustrated with great color photographs.
customer_reviews.author: neildspring

product_meta.title: Stokes Butterfly Book : The Complete Guide to Butterfly Gardening, Identification, and Behavior
